qas.question: How many Boers were taken prisoner during the Second Boer War?
Why was Dinuzulu kaCetshwayo imprisoned on the island?

answers.text: leading a Zulu army against British rule

context: The island was uninhabited when discovered by the Portuguese in <a0_0>1502<a0_0/>. One of the most remote islands in the world, it was for centuries an important stopover for ships sailing to Europe from Asia and South Africa. Napoleon was imprisoned there in exile by the British, as were Dinuzulu kaCetshwayo (for <a2_0>leading a Zulu army against British rule<a2_0/>) and <a1_0>more than 5,000<a1_0/> Boers taken prisoner during the Second Boer War.
